sourceDesc.p: MS Julian Browning. Address: Mr. James Beal | H.M.S. OrlandoSydney Smith Haldimand Dickens (1847-72), CD’s fifth son, served as midshipman on H.M.S. Orlando from 6 December 1861 to 12 May 1864; on 10 May he was deprived of one year’s time. He left the Orlando in May and joined H.M.S. Pelican in June 1864, being allowed 8 months of the time of which he had been deprived (MS National Archive). / Mediterranean Station. PM 11 Oct 64. On mourning paper.

dateline.placeName: GAD’S HILL PLACE|HIGHAM BY ROCHESTER, KENT.

body.p: Mr. Charles Dickens encloses Mr. James Beal, his cheque upon his London Bankers (payable to Mr. James Beal’s order)J.Beal drew £10.0.0 on 9 November 1864 according to CD’s account at Coutts’s Bank. in discharge of the amount of the billA legally-enforcable IOU, the loan to be repaid, with interest, at an agreed date. No doubt Sydney had raised the money to cover his debts. which Mr. Beal cashed for his son, Mr. Sydney Smith Dickens, now of H.M.S. “Pelican.”
